Résumé

PDF version

tl;dr

Software engineer at Red Hat; fellow and board member of the Python Software Foundation; founder and leader of PyLadiesSF; frequent speaker at Python-centric conferences.

Skills

  • Languages: Python (intermediate), Ruby (basic), SQL (basic)
  • Operating Systems: Linux (Fedora, RHEL), Mac OS X
  • Tools: Vim/vi, git, Postgres, MySQL, Puppet, Apache

Projects

  • newcoder.io: Five extensive Python tutorials for the new coder.
    • March 2013 - present
  • salar.ly: Provides users to browse all salaries of foreign-born US residents.
    • December 2012

Experience

Associate Software Engineer – Red Hat, Inc

October 2012 – present
  • Develop and contribute to freeIPA, an open-sourced, Linux-based identity management system written in Python.
  • Integrate freeIPA into key Open Source projects, including OpenShift Origin, OpenShift Enterprise, and OpenShift CLI tools.
  • Create better installation tools for freeIPA with provisioners like Puppet + IPA, and Vagrant + IPA, as well as Puppet + OpenShift + IPA and Vagrant + OpenShift + IPA.
  • Design and implement features to better improve IPA for integration projects, e.g. better integration with external provisioning systems, including Puppet, and the ability to work with updating IPA’s DNS more user-friendly.
  • Act as an ambassador between Open Source projects and freeIPA to improve communication, implementation, and community.

Related documentation written for integration:

  • OpenShift Broker + mod_auth_kerb for IdM/IPA
  • OpenShift Broker + IPA with Dynamic DNS and GSS-TSIG Updates
  • OpenShift Enterprise with IPA and Windows Active Directory.

Relevant blog posts written and talks given while at Red Hat:

  • DefCon for Pythonistas: PRISM
  • Explain like I'm 5: Kerberos
  • Netsec for n00bs part 1, part 2, part 3
  • DjangoCon EU: Introduce Django to your old friends.

Developer & Statistician – Harvard University

Summer 2012
  • Developed and migrated a MySQL database that houses previous and future Harvard CS50 students’ demographic and registrar information as well as edX online students, a joint venture between Harvard and MIT.
  • Developed front- and back-end website in Drupal for students and staff for the purpose of problem set survey and form rendering and capturing.
  • Rewrote and updated Python API wrapper for the online form service, WuFoo.

Web Developer – Independent Contractor

Summer 2012
  • Backend Django + JavaScript web developement for ActiveFrequency and FTW Group.
